p: India is known for its millets throughout the world, and the nutrition they provide is of great significance to human immune system growth (Sarkar et al. 2015). Millets (more recently known as nutri-cereals) are nutritionally superior to major cereals (wheat and rice) for carbohydrates and energy, and serve as a good source of protein, high dietary fibre, vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and micronutrients, as VA Tonapi, Director of the IIMR-ICAR, has noted (The Hindu Business Line dated 28/04/2020) .
